Smalltalk Objects over the Web

  • Most Smalltalk implementations provide a way to store objects to bytes, and then later restore the objects from bytes.

  • Given this, Smalltalk objects can just be a new MIME type that can be distributed via HTTP

  • What would you do with them

    • Given a Web browser with links to Smalltalk, Smalltalk could then do something useful with that object.
Page 15
Software Solutions - Patrick J. Mueller (pmuellr@vnet.ibm.com)
For the OOPSLA '95 Workshop on Objects, Scripts and the Web.
